013package org.apache.juneau.xml;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.XmlFormat.*;
018
019import java.util.*;
020
021import org.apache.juneau.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.*;
023
024/**
025 * Metadata on beans specific to the XML serializers and parsers pulled from the {@link Xml @Xml} annotation on the
026 * class.
027 *
028 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
029 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/XmlBasics">XML Basics</a>
030 * </ul>
031 */
032public class XmlBeanMeta extends ExtendedBeanMeta {
033
034   // XML related fields
035   private final Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> attrs;                        // Map of bean properties that are represented as XML attributes.
036   private final Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> elements;                     // Map of bean properties that are represented as XML elements.
037   private final BeanPropertyMeta attrsProperty;                            // Bean property that contain XML attribute key/value pairs for this bean.
038   private final Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> collapsedProperties;          // Properties defined with @Xml.childName annotation.
039   private final BeanPropertyMeta contentProperty;
040   private final XmlFormat contentFormat;
041
042   /**
043    * Constructor.
044    *
045    * @param beanMeta The metadata on the bean that this metadata applies to.
046    * @param mp XML metadata provider (for finding information about other artifacts).
047    */
048   public XmlBeanMeta(BeanMeta<?> beanMeta, XmlMetaProvider mp) {
049      super(beanMeta);
050
051      Class<?> c = beanMeta.getClassMeta().getInnerClass();
052      XmlBeanMetaBuilder b = new XmlBeanMetaBuilder(beanMeta, mp);
053
054      attrs = u(b.attrs);
055      elements = u(b.elements);
056      attrsProperty = b.attrsProperty;
057      collapsedProperties = u(b.collapsedProperties);
058      contentProperty = b.contentProperty;
059      contentFormat = b.contentFormat;
060
061      // Do some validation.
062      if (contentProperty != null || contentFormat == XmlFormat.VOID) {
063         if (! elements.isEmpty())
064            throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "{0} and ELEMENT properties found on the same bean.  These cannot be mixed.", contentFormat);
065         if (! collapsedProperties.isEmpty())
066            throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "{0} and COLLAPSED properties found on the same bean.  These cannot be mixed.", contentFormat);
067      }
068
069      if (! collapsedProperties.isEmpty()) {
070         if (! Collections.disjoint(elements.keySet(), collapsedProperties.keySet()))
071            throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Child element name conflicts found with another property.");
072      }
073   }
074
075   private static class XmlBeanMetaBuilder {
076      Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta>
077         attrs = map(),
078         elements = map(),
079         collapsedProperties = map();
080      BeanPropertyMeta
081         attrsProperty,
082         contentProperty;
083      XmlFormat contentFormat = DEFAULT;
084
085      XmlBeanMetaBuilder(BeanMeta<?> beanMeta, XmlMetaProvider mp) {
086         Class<?> c = beanMeta.getClassMeta().getInnerClass();
087         Value<XmlFormat> defaultFormat = Value.empty();
088
089         mp.forEachAnnotation(Xml.class, c, x-> true, x -> {
090            XmlFormat xf = x.format();
091            if (xf == ATTRS)
092               defaultFormat.set(XmlFormat.ATTR);
093            else if (xf.isOneOf(ELEMENTS, DEFAULT))
094               defaultFormat.set(ELEMENT);
095            else if (xf == VOID) {
096               contentFormat = VOID;
097               defaultFormat.set(VOID);
098            }
099            else
100               throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Invalid format specified in @Xml annotation on bean: {0}.  Must be one of the following: DEFAULT,ATTRS,ELEMENTS,VOID", x.format());
101         });
102
103         beanMeta.forEachProperty(null, p -> {
104            XmlFormat xf = mp.getXmlBeanPropertyMeta(p).getXmlFormat();
105            ClassMeta<?> pcm = p.getClassMeta();
106            if (xf == ATTR) {
107               attrs.put(p.getName(), p);
108            } else if (xf == ELEMENT) {
109               elements.put(p.getName(), p);
110            } else if (xf == COLLAPSED) {
111               collapsedProperties.put(p.getName(), p);
112            } else if (xf == DEFAULT) {
113               if (defaultFormat.get() == ATTR)
114                  attrs.put(p.getName(), p);
115               else
116                  elements.put(p.getName(), p);
117            } else if (xf == ATTRS) {
118               if (attrsProperty != null)
119                  throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Multiple instances of ATTRS properties defined on class.  Only one property can be designated as such.");
120               if (! pcm.isMapOrBean())
121                  throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Invalid type for ATTRS property.  Only properties of type Map and bean can be used.");
122               attrsProperty = p;
123            } else if (xf.isOneOf(ELEMENTS, MIXED, MIXED_PWS, TEXT, TEXT_PWS, XMLTEXT)) {
124               if (xf.isOneOf(ELEMENTS, MIXED, MIXED_PWS) && ! pcm.isCollectionOrArray())
125                  throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Invalid type for {0} property.  Only properties of type Collection and array can be used.", xf);
126               if (contentProperty != null) {
127                  if (xf == contentFormat)
128                     throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Multiple instances of {0} properties defined on class.  Only one property can be designated as such.", xf);
129                  throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "{0} and {1} properties found on the same bean.  Only one property can be designated as such.", contentFormat, xf);
130               }
131               contentProperty = p;
132               contentFormat = xf;
133            }
134            // Look for any properties that are collections with @Xml.childName specified.
135            String n = mp.getXmlBeanPropertyMeta(p).getChildName();
136            if (n != null) {
137               if (collapsedProperties.containsKey(n) && collapsedProperties.get(n) != p)
138                  throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Multiple properties found with the child name ''{0}''.", n);
139               collapsedProperties.put(n, p);
140            }
141         });
142      }
143   }
144
145   /**
146    * The list of properties that should be rendered as XML attributes.
147    *
148    * @return Map of property names to property metadata.
149    */
150   public Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> getAttrProperties() {
151      return attrs;
152   }
153
154   /**
155    * The list of names of properties that should be rendered as XML attributes.
156    *
157    * @return Set of property names.
158    */
159   protected Set<String> getAttrPropertyNames() {
160      return attrs.keySet();
161   }
162
163   /**
164    * The list of properties that should be rendered as child elements.
165    *
166    * @return Map of property names to property metadata.
167    */
168   protected Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> getElementProperties() {
169      return elements;
170   }
171
172   /**
173    * The list of names of properties that should be rendered as child elements.
174    *
175    * @return Set of property names.
176    */
177   protected Set<String> getElementPropertyNames() {
178      return elements.keySet();
179   }
180
181   /**
182    * The list of properties that should be rendered as collapsed child elements.
183    * <br>See {@link Xml#childName() @Xml(childName)}
184    *
185    * @return Map of property names to property metadata.
186    */
187   protected Map<String,BeanPropertyMeta> getCollapsedProperties() {
188      return collapsedProperties;
189   }
190
191   /**
192    * The list of names of properties that should be rendered as collapsed child elements.
193    *
194    * @return Set of property names.
195    */
196   protected Set<String> getCollapsedPropertyNames() {
197      return collapsedProperties.keySet();
198   }
199
200   /**
201    * The property that returns a map of XML attributes as key/value pairs.
202    *
203    * @return The bean property metadata, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no such method.
204    */
205   protected BeanPropertyMeta getAttrsProperty() {
206      return attrsProperty;
207   }
208
209   /**
210    * The name of the property that returns a map of XML attributes as key/value pairs.
211    *
212    * @return The bean property name, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no such method.
213    */
214   protected String getAttrsPropertyName() {
215      return attrsProperty == null ? null : attrsProperty.getName();
216   }
217
218   /**
219    * The property that represents the inner XML content of this bean.
220    *
221    * @return The bean property metadata, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no such method.
222    */
223   public BeanPropertyMeta getContentProperty() {
224      return contentProperty;
225   }
226
227   /**
228    * The name of the property that represents the inner XML content of this bean.
229    *
230    * @return The bean property name, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no such method.
231    */
232   protected String getContentPropertyName() {
233      return contentProperty == null ? null : contentProperty.getName();
234   }
235
236   /**
237    * Returns the format of the inner XML content of this bean.
238    *
239    * <p>
240    * Can be one of the following:
241    * <ul>
242    *    <li>{@link XmlFormat#ELEMENTS}
243    *    <li>{@link XmlFormat#MIXED}
244    *    <li>{@link XmlFormat#MIXED_PWS}
245    *    <li>{@link XmlFormat#TEXT}
246    *    <li>{@link XmlFormat#TEXT_PWS}
247    *    <li>{@link XmlFormat#XMLTEXT}
248    *    <li>{@link XmlFormat#VOID}
249    *    <li><jk>null</jk>
250    * </ul>
251    *
252    * @return The format of the inner XML content of this bean.
253    */
254   public XmlFormat getContentFormat() {
255      return contentFormat;
256   }
257
258   /**
259    * Returns bean property meta with the specified name.
260    *
261    * <p>
262    * This is identical to calling {@link BeanMeta#getPropertyMeta(String)} except it first retrieves the bean property
263    * meta based on the child name (e.g. a property whose name is "people", but whose child name is "person").
264    *
265    * @param fieldName The bean property name.
266    * @return The property metadata.
267    */
268   protected BeanPropertyMeta getPropertyMeta(String fieldName) {
269      if (collapsedProperties != null) {
270         BeanPropertyMeta bpm = collapsedProperties.get(fieldName);
271         if (bpm == null)
272            bpm = collapsedProperties.get("*");
273         if (bpm != null)
274            return bpm;
275      }
276      return getBeanMeta().getPropertyMeta(fieldName);
277   }
278}
